results.title: Sex, lies and videotape
results.creator_credit: Steven Soderbergh, John Hardy, Robert Newmyer and Outlaw Productions
results.brief_description: A selfish, successful lawyer (Peter Gallagher) - whose wife (Andie MacDowell) has been turned off sex is having an affair with his sister-in-law (Laura San Giacomo). He welcomes an old college friend (James Spader) for a visit, not realising the amazing effect that he will have on all of them. A finely honed tale of adultery, impotence and dangerous liaisons. Strong women, weak men; a quartet defined by their erotic impulses and inhibitions. This is Steven Soderbergh’s first feature, and it won him Best Film and James Spader Best Actor at the Cannes Film Festival in 1989.

results.title: California suite
results.creator_credit: Herbert Ross, Ray Stark and Columbia Films
results.brief_description: Five couples find themselves in a Beverley Hills hotel during the week of the Oscars. Four stories blend with an all star cast and the slick writing style of Neil Simon, to produce a comedy about human behaviour in all its variety. Maggie Smith won the Oscar for this 1970’s comedy which made the transition from the New York Stage to the big screen. Also stars: Jane Fonda, Alan Alda, Michael Caine, Walter Matthau, Elaine May, Herb Edelman, Denise Galik, Richard Pryor, Bill Cosby, Gloria Gifford and Sheila Frazier.

results.title: Lost horizon
results.brief_description: Based on the international best-seller by James Hilton, this Hollywood classic made ‘Shangri La’ a household word. Ronald Colman, one of the few stars to successfully make the transition from the silent era to “talkies”, stars as a British consul who, together with a planeload of American and English passengers, flees war-torn China only to be hijacked to Tibet where he is taken to a remote idyllic Utopian community in the Himalayas where he has been chosen to become the next High Lama.

results.title: A Woman's face
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Victor Saville and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: In Stockholm, a trial for murder takes place - the accused is Anna Holm, a notorious woman believed to have murdered her former lover and partner in crime. The story which unfolds is intense, suspenseful and gripping. The climax is riveting. Joan Crawford will amaze you as Anna Holm, a multi-layered characterization posing intriguing emotional and psychological suggestions. The strange relationship between Anna and the sardonic Jorsten Barring is excitingly brought to dramatic life by Joan Crawford and Conrad Veidt. Melvyn Douglas plays Dr. Segert, the plastic surgeon who turns the scarred Anna Holm into a beautiful woman without erasing the scars of her soul. From the play “Il etait une fois” by Francis De Croisset.

results.title: Meet John Doe (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Frank Capra, Liberty Films and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: In this acclaimed Capra extravaganza, warning against the threat of fascism, Gary Cooper portrays a naive street tramp who becomes the unwitting tool of corrupt politicians. Journalist, Ann Mitchell (Barbara Stanwyck) conveys the story of John Doe, who then becomes the voice of the people and the champion of decency and fair play. Doe threatens suicide as the ultimate protest against corruption; and thousands of good citizens rally to prevent his death. Director Frank Capra weaves touching comedy into this powerful screen masterpiece. Also stars Edward Arnold and Walter Brennan.

results.title: The Player
results.creator_credit: Robert Altman, David Brown, Michael Tolkin, Nick Wechsler, Avenue Pictures and Spelling International
results.brief_description: A sharp critique of Hollywood greed and power, director Robert Altman hits nails on heads as this Faustian black comedy unfolds on the screen. This cynical story begins with Griffin Mill (Tim Robbins), a smarmy young studio executive who is being threatened by a disgruntled and previously rejected screenwriter. Griffin decides to take the law into his own hands and accidentally kills the writer. Will he get away with it? Whoopi Goldberg is hilarious as the unconventional detective investigating the murder, Greta Scacchi is strange and seductive as the dead writer’s girlfriend and Peter Gallagher is truly slimy as the rising young star executive. The film also includes cameo appearances from sixty-five of Hollywood’s biggest names.

results.title: Country
results.creator_credit: Richard Pearce, Jessica Lange, William D Whittliff, Far West Productions and Pangaea Corporation
results.brief_description: A deeply-felt variation of the classic struggle of the working man versus the forces of government. Iowa farmers, Jewell and Gil Ivy (Jessica Lange and Sam Shephard) work a poor farm held by their family for generations. Shephard delivers a performance of immense integrity in his portrayal of a man humiliated because he is unable to provide for his family. The screenplay reflects recent events in the US where struggling farmers took on government loans to expand and wound up faced with foreclosure on their properties.

results.title: Born yesterday
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, S. Sylvan Simon and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Classic Hollywood comedy starring Judy Holliday and William Holden. Judy’s riotous performance as Billy Dawn, the clever ‘dumb blonde’, won her the 1951 Academy Award. Billy, her shady boyfriend and all his thugs move to a Washington hotel to begin wheeling and dealing in the political scene. To get her out of his way, and make her a little more cultured, and dignified, Billy’s gangster boyfriend (Broderick Crawford) hires Holden to teach her. Hilarious scenes and famous lines dot this film which has remained unforgettably and indelibly in the minds of audiences the world over. Based on the stage play by Garson Kanin.

results.title: Sunday bloody Sunday
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Joseph Janni and Vectia Films
results.brief_description: Glenda Jackson, a career woman separated from her husband, and Peter Finch, a Jewish doctor, are caught in a love triangle with a young bisexual designer. Although the arrangement appears ideal, the trio must deal with the jealousy, fear and self doubt they encounter. This absorbing character study, originally shocking, is regarded as a forerunner of cinema’s increasingly mature treatment of homosexuality. Also stars Peggy Ashcroft.

results.title: Murder at the gallop
results.creator_credit: George Pollock, George H. Brown and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Based upon the novel “After the funeral” also published as “Funerals are fatal” by Agatha Christie. Mr Enderby, a wealthy and elderly man, dies unexpectedly and his not-so-bereaved relatives gather for the reading of the will. The speculation that he may have been murdered intensifies when another relative is slain, begging the question, “Who will be next?” Starring Margaret Rutherford, Robert Morley, Flora Robson and Stringer Davis.
